job.title: Research Associate_ Lab Manager
job.plaincontent:
At Roche, we believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives and we are fearless in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world. That is why we come to work each day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigor, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.
The Position
Roche Research and Development (pRED) Oncology translates world-class science into medical innovation through a diversity of technologies and talents located across four research centers worldwide (Basel, Munich, Welwyn and Zurich).
We are seeking an exceptional, highly motivated and talented Research Associate to join the team as a Lab Manager.
You will be a member of the Molecular Targeted Therapies (MTT) group focused on the discovery of novel anti-cancer agents and is located at Roche Innovation Center Basel. MTT is composed of approximately 30 cancer biologists supported by Roche’s Small Molecule Research (SMR) and Pharmaceutical Sciences (PS) functions in state-of-the art molecular and cellular pharmacology laboratories.
Core tasks and responsibilities:
- Placing and expediting orders for project-specific reagents and biological samples in consultation with research associates & lab heads. Verifying receipt of supplies. Including identification of cost savings. - Safety Health and Environment (SHE): Organize and manage regulatory lab safety compliance including institutional protocols and licenses related to biological and chemical safety. Supporting SHE representatives and lab members for WHRA and for inspections. Organize and manage BSL1/2 lab safety documentation. - Organizing/creating shared consumables stocks. Maintaining optimal stock inventory level, anticipating needed supplies and maintaining a universal database of reagents. - Managing and updating SED and other inventories of lab equipment. Organizing service contracts and coordinating laboratory equipment maintenance, pipet calibration, yearly freezer and fridge cycling. - Together with lab associates, ensure that the laboratories are cleaned/sanitized and kept in an orderly manner. Daily removal of laboratory waste. - Manage material & sample shipping. - On-boarding new staff - Build an appropriate on-boarding protocol and lead on-boarding of new employees.
Who You Are
You are a self-motivated biologist with excellent organizational and communication skills, fully committed to team effort but able to work in an independent fashion.
For this position, we expect the following qualifications:
- Apprentice or BSc cell biology, preferable with a focus in oncology or immunology - 2+ years of experience in a biology research lab with responsibilities of a lab manager - Prior experience in the pharmaceutical industry required - Familiarity with cell culture, basic molecule biology techniques and compound screening is required - Familiarity with standard lab equipment, automation and IT tools is required. - Excellent oral and written communication skills in English is required, German being highly desirable. - Experience in ordering lab equipment, material and managing inventory - Reliable and solid working manner - Excellent interpersonal communication and problem solving skills - Knowledge about processes and infrastructure at the Roche Innovation Center Basel is desirable - Experience in Laboratory management is desirable
*For non-EU / EFTA citizens: Please state your eligibility status to work in Switzerland (e.g. B-Permit, C-Permit) and note that if you do not own a valid Swiss work permit, Roche cannot guarantee your final employment due to authority regulations.
** PhD's and Postdocs's cannot be considered for associate roles in Roche pRED.
If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients’ lives. If you want to work in a passionate team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now.
Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job.title: Administrative Professional in PD Biometrics
job.plaincontent:
At Roche, we believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patient’s lives and we are fearless in both making decisions and taking action. And we believe that good business means a better world.
The Basel Biometrics Admin Team sits under Product Development Biometrics where we strive to deliver data and insights about our medicines with excellence and passion. We provide administrative support to Management and Staff of Basel Biometrics by anticipating, determining and fulfilling their needs.
In your role as Associate Administrative Professional you provide support to management and staff of the Basel Pharma Development Biometrics Department in organizing and booking business trips, processing reimbursement of expenses and general administrative tasks.
Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:
- Proactively anticipate business needs and provide timely and accurate administrative support - Responsible for logistics and organization of meetings and video-conferences and coordination of these activities, provide relevant documentation and materials as necessary and according to compliance requirements - Attend and lead team meetings, take meeting minutes, support managers in recruitment, interview and induction process, process purchase requests, purchase orders, and invoices - Assist business partners in contract processes, keep an overview of contracts incl. tracking status of new contract requests, maintaining records and files - Use software and tools to meet Roche and compliance requirements and procedures - Exercise independent judgment and discretion with sensitive/confidential and proprietary information - Address problems and develop practical, thorough, and creative solutions - An active member of the PDB Admin Team
Experience, Skills, Knowledge
- An enthusiastic, flexible and customer-oriented person who enjoys working in a team - Excellent communication skills; ability to listen actively, high level of assertiveness, ability to give and receive feedback - Excellent organizational, time management and problem-solving skills, able to work with ambiguity managing multiple work streams at once with a diverse set of stakeholders - Understanding the importance of confidentiality and the ability to handle sensitive situations with respect - An analytical and structured thinking person who displays professionalism in all internal and external endeavors - Exposure to agile ways of working
Education/Qualification
- Business qualification (e.g. Kaufmännische Lehre) or equivalent - Minimum 3 years’ experience working in an administrative environment that required professionalism, organization, confidentiality, and accuracy - Good verbal and written communication and collaboration skills in English - Proficiency with Microsoft Office and related business applications and openness and proven ability to adapt quickly new technologies
